result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marlo P Phillips Jr

records.addlTxt: Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 11/3/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Ocean E.
- Defendant shall not be in the 2200 block of Post Rd.
Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.

11:02 AM Defendant Marlo P Phillips Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer Amelia Cunha in court for Marlo P Phillips Jr.  Attorney Tess Lewangowski in court for State of Wisconsin. DE advised of right to and waived preliminary hearing (PLQ for handed in). 
Court hears state on bond. DA states DE is on DOC hold, requests signature bond. Court accepts joint recommendation, modifies to $500 signature bond with same conditions as previous cash bond.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Ocean E.
- Defendant shall not be in the 2200 block of Post Rd.
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 7

2:24 PM Defendant Marlo P Phillips Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Marlo P Phillips Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Tim Helmberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
